text:
Many AWS
customers have come to enjoy the benefits

of Amazon Simple Storage Service
or S3 for its scalability

data availability,
durability and performance.

Amazon S3 has become the destination
to build, store and grow

for customers of all sizes and industries
to protect any amount of data

for virtually any use case,
including those such as data, lakes,

cloud, native
applications and mobile applications too.

In recent years, our customers have asked
us for ways to be able to build faster

and run faster, especially
for their performance critical workloads.
Hi, my name is Christie Lee.

I'm a principal storage Solutions
architect with AWS, and I'm excited

to share with you how you can get started
with Amazon S3 Express One Zone.
Amazon S3 Express

One Zone is Amazon's new High Performance
Object Storage offering.

It is purpose built to deliver consistent
single digit millisecond latency

for your most frequently accessed
data and latency sensitive applications.
Now you may be wondering,

well,
how much faster is Amazon S3 Express?

We've designed it to be up to ten times
faster

than Amazon S3 standard
while delivering hundreds

of thousands of transactions
per second or TPS per bucket.

S3 Express One Zone is the first
S3 storage class where you can specify

which availability zone
you would like to store your objects.

This allows you
to co-locate compute resources
such as easy to EKS and ECS

to achieve that low latency and higher
throughput.

The way S3 Express One Zone optimizes
performance is with purpose

built hardware and software to achieve
optimized data processing speeds.
You'll be able to use S3 Express
One Zone with analytics,

machine
learning workloads, open source frameworks

such as PyTorch to accelerate performance
critical workloads

while reducing overall
total cost of ownership

due to quicker processing times resulting
from lower compute costs overall.
With S3 Express One Zone,

you'll be able to accelerate your machine
learning and analytics workloads

with Amazon's fully managed services
such as EMR, Athena and Sage Maker.

We look forward to seeing
what our customers will be able to do

with these performance improvements for
their for their workloads in these cases.

A couple of recommendations
if you are looking to get started.

With S3 Express One Zone we introduced S3
directory buckets where your S3 Express

One Zone objects are stored in a single
availability center of your choosing

for your computer and applications
to access your directory buckets,

we recommend a VPC Gateway endpoint
per VPC
for routing traffic within your VPC over
Amazon's private network
By default

users will need to be granted permissions
in order to access new access

directory buckets and the S3 Express
One Zone and objects.
S3 Express introduces a new fast

authorization model
through the use of the CREATE Session API.
This is

to give you control of users,
groups and roles
for access to S3 Express One Zone objects
and with the new enhancements and APIs.

Be sure to check that you're
using the latest AWS SDK software

development kit and CLI versions
to be able to access
new express APIs.
We'll be jumping into a demo,

but as a quick overview of what
the demo will show,

we'll show you how to create a new
S3 directory bucket as well as

how do you import a sample dataset
between an S3 general purpose bucket
into an S3 directory bucket?
Let's get into it

One thing you'll notice is

that you'll now have the option to choose
between bucket types.

There are going to be general purpose
buckets as well as S3 directory buckets.

General purpose buckets
are the default Amazon S3 bucket type

that are used for the vast
majority of S3 use cases.

These support a mix of storage classes
and redundantly store

objects across
multiple availability zones.

If you're an existing Amazon S3 customer,
it's likely

you already have a couple of general
purpose buckets deployed today.

If you're looking to try out
Amazon S3 Express One Zone,

for object access for those performance

You'll also need to specify

This will be ideal

for your performance
if you choose the availability zone

resources.

Yes, you can.

Import is fully managed by Amazon S3 Batch
